item.title: ::addobject command
item.dc:creator: @For For ( ; ; )
item.description:
@For wrote:

if (command.startsWith("object")) { try { int object = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,12)); int orient = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13,14)); int type = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(15)); AddGlobalObj(absX, absY, object, orient, type); } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Bad object ID"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: ::addobject command
item.dc:creator: @webhostbudd webhostbudd
item.description:
@webhostbudd wrote:

I have been working on a code that makes objects by name, x and y. This is the code that I made, but it catches the exception every time.

if (command.startsWith("addobject") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("webhostbudd")) { try { int newObjectID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11)); int newObjectX = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12,16)); int newObjectY = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(17,21)); if (newObjectID <= 10000 && newObjectID >= 0) { makeGlobalObject(newObjectX, newObjectY, newObjectID, 0, 10); } else { sendMessage("No such Object."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::addobject # x y"); } }
I also plan on making a way to turn the object, but first i need to get the spawn working.

Read full topic
